content.description: Start on a good edge below/left a zigzagging crack system. Bump up to the higher edge, smear your feet, and make a dead point/dyno up to a good edge. Follow great holds to top out.CAUTION: the blocks up top felt solid, but if you're a heavier climber, then definitely scope it out first. I'd hate to see someone get hurt.
content.location: On the wall ten meters right of the 666 slab, start on the obvious lower edge to the right side.

content.description: Start right of the large offwidth. Start matched on the lowest of the good holds. Climb the right side up the same rock as 666 staying off of Razorclaw.
content.location: It is between Razorclaw and 666 in the diagonal offwidth.

content.description: Sit start the sharp arete to the left of the 666 slab. Figure out a scrunchy start making a couple tough opening moves. Continue upwards to better holds.Stay off the slab behind you, and avoid the tree on topout.
content.protection: Crashpads and perhaps a spotter. The landing is a bit funky but not too bad.
content.location: Left of the 666 slab, this climbs the obvious, sharp arete.

content.description: Start on the huge jug in a horizontal crack at the right of the face. Climb slightly right and up following good holds to an unnerving topout at the rock's highest point. If you project anywhere below V3, then I'd recommend a spotter. This has awesome movement on great rock with enough difficulty up top to keep you on your toes.
content.location: It climbs the right side of the big slab on a series of block jugs and cracks.

content.description: Start sitting in the small cave on a triangular block hold. Make a powerful move out left on a decent edge just above the lip. Make a long reach, and gain a slopey rail. Navigate a couple more moves with delicate technique and balance to establish yourself on the slab which takes you through progressively easier moves and a V1 victory lap to the top.
content.protection: Crashpads. 2 felt comfortable, but more is better, and a spotter isn’t a bad idea either.
content.location: On the obvious, 16 foot slab with a small overhang beneath, look for a big, triangular-shaped block in the cave.

content.description: Some of the highest quality lines can be found above the talus field along a series of small cliffs/ledges. The cliff band is comprised of a few sections of rock of varying height which are all connected. Their heights range anywhere up to about 16 feet. Be wary as some of the landing zones slope downhill.
